Reiustre, that simply isn't true. That sentiment has never been expressed within the works themselves, and unless you can produce some article or interview in which the author DOES express such a sentiment, your assertion will remain nothing more than a baseless harangue. I would dearly love to be proven wrong here, as I'll always appreciate opportunities to attain a greater understanding of an author's perspective. However, considering all that I've seen from your posts, I feel that you are, in all likelihood, talking out your ass. Thank you for your time.

@sasukeislove: Well, since you surely read my comment thoroughly, you must understand that I did acknowledge this scenario as non-canon to the official series. However, as I also previously mentioned, the setting for *this* work has already been established to have separate circumstances; being the third entry in this line of works, a precedent has been set that would make the "Netorare" tag inappropriate. 

And again, incest isn't valid, as no direct interaction occurs between Sakura (Mother) and Sarada (Daughter) at any point.

Ah, and I almost forgot: incest definitely doesn't apply here, as no direct interaction between Sakura and Sarada ever occurs, only the both of them sucking Naruto off at the same time.

Well, racial commentary aside... There actually is quite a bit of variety amongst these works; Sakura and Sarada, of course, and also Hinata, Tsunade... Ino and Shizune, and even Tenten. Also, I can't agree that Netorare is an appropriate tag here; Sasuke isn't even mentioned in this one, and earlier chapters essentially established the setting where servicing "The Seventh" is an accepted practice for all female residents of Konoha, married or otherwise. While obviously not canon to the actual story, it IS this story's premise, so... Anyways, I've said my piece. Feel free to share any thoughts you may have.
